availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Daniel Shawhan Jr. (Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Daniel Shawhan Sr. and Minerva Shawhan. Resident in Bourbon County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned twelve enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1850. Farmer in Bourbon County in 1860. Household owned nineteen enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 2, p. 251B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 2, p. 409.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 548.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 113B-114A.
"Daniel B. Shawhan Jr. (1837-1868)," Find A Grave, Memorial #8346705, accessed May 23, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8346705.
